heaviest_rainfall.status: Record-breaking rain fell on 09 November 2025 with a total accumulation of 47.89mm over 144.8 hours and falling at a rate of 24.6mm per hour at times.

heaviest_rainrate.status: The rain rate reached 34.3mm per hour on 02 September 2025, and resulted in 21.19mm of rain over 15.0 hours.  This is the highest rate recorded by our weather station.

longest_rain.status: The longest rain storm on record lasted 144.8 hours on 09 November 2025 when 47.89mm of rain fell and at one point was falling at 24.6mm per hour.

most_lightning.status: The most lightning strikes in one day since 11 April 2025 is 23 and it happened on 07 September 2025.

storm.status: Stormy conditions are expected.  This is the first storm in the region since 02 February 2026.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 13 January 2026 and lasted for 22 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not an active cold snap.  There has been 3 so far this year, while the average is 3.6.

extreme.status: The highest recorded temperature difference is 26.7°C from 29 April 2025 (when the temperature reached 27.1°C but fell to 0.4°C).

heatwaves.status: At the moment, it is not a heatwaves.  This year has seen 0 heatwavess; typically, 1.9 heatwavess happen every year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (193°).  In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: 128.2 mph is the largest wind gust recorded on 27 January 2026.

run.status: The record wind run remains at 1737 miles from 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The top recorded wind speed is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

top_10_windy.status: A significant windy period is on-going and is ranked 5th for length since 23 September 2024.  So far, it has lasted 4 consecutive days beginning 02 February 2026.  The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Today, more moisture-laden rainfall (up 1.0 mm).

Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in cloud levels (up 297 m).

Today’s average cloud levels is 296.8m lower than yesterday, 77.1m lower than the past week, 72.3m lower than the past month.

Yesterday’s cloud levels showed a low of 530m and a peak of 1993m, averaging 714.0m; the week and month recorded warmer averages.

summary.summary: Inside; temperatures should be quite comfortable. Outside; cold temperatures are forecasted. Also, dry and less humid conditions and very little to no wind will be present. Rain showers likely, overcast skies with low cloud, and low sunlight due to cloudy or overcast skies. Changeable conditions.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (97%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
